fr.xephi.authme.permission

Class PermissionsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.permission.PermissionsManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Reloadable

    public class PermissionsManager
extends Object
implements Reloadable
    PermissionsManager.

    A permissions manager, to manage and use various permissions systems. This manager supports dynamic plugin hooking and various other features.

    Written by Tim Visée.

    Version:
    0.3
    Author:
    Tim Visée, http://timvisee.com

    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Check if the permissions manager is currently hooked into any of the supported permissions systems.
        Returns:
        False if there isn't any permissions system used.

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reload the permissions manager, and re-hook all permission plugins.
        Specified by:
        reload in interface Reloadable

      • onPluginEnable

        public void onPluginEnable(String pluginName)
        Method called when a plugin is being enabled.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - The name of the plugin being enabled.

      • onPluginDisable

        public void onPluginDisable(String pluginName)
        Method called when a plugin is being disabled.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - The name of the plugin being disabled.

      • getPermissionSystem

        public PermissionsSystemType getPermissionSystem()
        Return the permissions system that is hooked into.
        Returns:
        The permissions system, or null.

      • hasPermission

        public boolean hasPermission(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                             PermissionNode permissionNode)
        Check if the command sender has permission for the given permissions node. If no permissions system is used or if the sender is not a player (e.g. console user), the player has to be OP in order to have the permission.
        Parameters:
        sender - The command sender.
        permissionNode - The permissions node to verify.
        Returns:
        True if the sender has the permission, false otherwise.

      • hasPermission

        public boolean hasPermission(JoiningPlayer joiningPlayer,
                             PermissionNode permissionNode)
        Check if the given player has permission for the given permission node.
        Parameters:
        joiningPlayer - The player to check
        permissionNode - The permission node to verify
        Returns:
        true if the player has permission, false otherwise

      • hasPermissionOffline

        public boolean hasPermissionOffline(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                                    PermissionNode permissionNode)
        Check if a player has permission for the given permission node. This is for offline player checks. If no permissions system is used, then the player will not have permission.
        Parameters:
        player - The offline player
        permissionNode - The permission node to verify
        Returns:
        true if the player has permission, false otherwise

      • hasPermissionOffline

        public boolean hasPermissionOffline(String name,
                                    PermissionNode permissionNode)
        Check whether the offline player with the given name has permission for the given permission node. This method is used as a last resort when nothing besides the name is known.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player
        permissionNode - The permission node to verify
        Returns:
        true if the player has permission, false otherwise

      • hasGroupSupport

        public boolean hasGroupSupport()
        Check whether the current permissions system has group support. If no permissions system is hooked, false will be returned.
        Returns:
        True if the current permissions system supports groups, false otherwise.

      • getGroups

        public Collection<String> getGroups(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)
        Get the permission groups of a player, if available.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        Returns:
        Permission groups, or an empty collection if this feature is not supported.

      • getPrimaryGroup

        public String getPrimaryGroup(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)
        Get the primary group of a player, if available.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        Returns:
        The name of the primary permission group. Or null.

      • isInGroup

        public boolean isInGroup(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                         String groupName)
        Check whether the player is in the specified group.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        groupName - The group name.
        Returns:
        True if the player is in the specified group, false otherwise. False is also returned if groups aren't supported by the used permissions system.

      • addGroup

        public boolean addGroup(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                        String groupName)
        Add the permission group of a player, if supported.
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        groupName - The name of the group.
        Returns:
        True if succeed, false otherwise. False is also returned if this feature isn't supported for the current permissions system.

      • addGroups

        public boolean addGroups(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                         Collection<String> groupNames)
        Add the permission groups of a player, if supported.
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        groupNames - The name of the groups to add.
        Returns:
        True if at least one group was added, false otherwise. False is also returned if this feature isn't supported for the current permissions system.

      • removeGroup

        public boolean removeGroup(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                           String groupName)
        Remove the permission group of a player, if supported.
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        groupName - The name of the group.
        Returns:
        True if succeed, false otherwise. False is also returned if this feature isn't supported for the current permissions system.

      • removeGroups

        public boolean removeGroups(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                            Collection<String> groupNames)
        Remove the permission groups of a player, if supported.
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        groupNames - The name of the groups to remove.
        Returns:
        True if at least one group was removed, false otherwise. False is also returned if this feature isn't supported for the current permissions system.

      • setGroup

        public boolean setGroup(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player,
                        String groupName)
        Set the permission group of a player, if supported. This clears the current groups of the player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        groupName - The name of the group.
        Returns:
        True if succeed, false otherwise. False is also returned if this feature isn't supported for the current permissions system.

      • removeAllGroups

        public boolean removeAllGroups(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)
        Remove all groups of the specified player, if supported. Systems like Essentials GroupManager don't allow all groups to be removed from a player, thus the user will stay in its primary group. All the subgroups are removed just fine.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to remove all groups from.
        Returns:
        True if succeed, false otherwise. False will also be returned if this feature isn't supported for the used permissions system.

      • loadUserData

        public boolean loadUserData(org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer offlinePlayer)
        Loads the permission data of the given player.
        Parameters:
        offlinePlayer - the offline player.
        Returns:
        true if the load was successful.

      • loadUserData

        public void loadUserData(UUID uuid)
                  throws PermissionLoadUserException
        Loads the permission data of the given player unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the UUID of the player.
        Throws:
        PermissionLoadUserException - if the action failed.
